Sun.description: The Sun is the central star of our Solar System, providing light and heat to all the planets.

Mercury.description: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun. It's a small, rocky world with a very thin atmosphere.

Venus.description: Venus has a thick, toxic atmosphere and surface temperatures hot enough to melt lead.

Earth.description: Earth is the only planet known to support life, with vast oceans and a breathable atmosphere.

Mars.description: Mars is a cold, desert-like planet with signs of ancient water and potential for past life.

Jupiter.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System, known for its Great Red Spot and many moons.

Saturn.description: Saturn is famous for its beautiful ring system and has over 80 moons.

Uranus.description: Uranus is an ice giant with a unique sideways rotation and pale blue color.

Neptune.description: Neptune is a cold, dark, and windy planet, farthest from the Sun in our Solar System.
